text: Nur Mahmudi Ismail (born November 11, 1961 in Kediri) was the Mayor of Depok City, a satellite city of West Java located in the southern part of Jakarta. ==Political career== Ismail was the first chairman of Prosperous Justice Party (formerly Justice Party), when the party was created in 1998. Later, after the 1999 general election, Ismail resigned from his position as the chairman of the party after being chosen by President Abdurrahman Wahid to serve as the minister of forestry in the United National Cabinet. He held this position from 1999 to 2000, when President Wahid replaced him with Marzuki Usman. ==Mayor== In 2005, together with his running mate, Yuyun Wirasaputra, Ismail narrowly won the mayoral election, beating the incumbent Badrul Kamal. == References == Category:Living people Category:1961 births Category:Mayors of Depok Category:People from Kediri, East Java Category:Government ministers of Indonesia Category:Prosperous Justice Party politicians Category:Javanese people
title: Nur Mahmudi Ismail
